item.title: China’s EV makers shine in ‘Golden September’ as exports double, flooding the global market
item.description: September is a traditional peak period for auto sales in China.

item.title: As AI fears continue, executives say a human in the loop in not enough—workers need to prioritize one skill
item.description: Workday, Microsoft, and Guild executives say AI will reward workers who can think critically and have good judgment.

item.title: The iconic Miami Seaquarium shuts down after dark legacy of animal abuse and crumbling conditions
item.description: Animals rights activists have lobbied for decades to free the marine mammals inside.

item.title: Hundreds of CDC ‘disease detectives’ fired—then reinstated—in mass layoffs tied to Trump shutdown
item.description: “Usually you think it’s nature that’s going to be giving you a hard time, the viruses, not the government," said Anne Schuchat, former principal deput...

item.title: Goldman Sachs posts record 3Q revenue of $15.18 billion, Solomon cites ‘improved market environment’
item.description: CEO David Solomon said the bank is prioritizing efficient operations "to seamlessly deliver the firm to our clients helped by new AI technologies."
